intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium murorum subsp. austrorhodopeum, commonly known as the Southern Carpathian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Carpathian Mountains. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers in clustered inflorescences. It is characterized by its robust root system and adaptability to various soil types. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its region.
